TextView.android:text: 8- If you noticed bruises on vein puncture site, follow these steps: Day 1: Wrap ice in a clean moist cloth and apply to the site for 15-20 minutes, 3-4 times during the day. Day 2,3 and 4: Apply a warm moist cloth to the site for 15-20 minutes, 3-4 times every day , you will notice color changes of the bruised area in the next 10 days. 9- If you experience dizziness or lightheadedness or feel like you are going to faint, sit down with your head between your knees or lie down with your legs elevated as soon as possible to avoid a potential fall and/or injury. Remain in this position until the condition improves . If symptoms persist, return to the blood bank or seek medical advice. 10- As a part of our routine procedure, the blood bank will test your donation to detect any blood transmitted infections. 11- In some instances when the infection is in its early phase (window period), our routine tests may fail to reveal the presence of such infection. Therefore, if you have any doubts about the safety of your blood, please call the Central Blood Bank at the number provided, as soon as possible and tell the physician in charge that you donâ€™t want your donation to be used for transfusion without the need to explain or to give any reasons. All information provided by you will be confidential.
